programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mutants
programme.desc: The Doctor is sent to a skybase orbiting the planet of Solos in the 30th century, where he must deliver a sealed message pod.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mutants
programme.desc: Ky flees to the planet's poisonous surface taking Jo with him while the Marshal, holding the Doctor captive, demands that he opens the message pod.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mutants
programme.desc: The Doctor searches for Jo in the caves of Solos. In the shadows the mutants prepare to attack.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mutants
programme.desc: The Doctor and Sondergaard make an amazing discovery in the caves of Solos while Jo falls into the Marshal's trap.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mutants
programme.desc: The Marshal's plans for Solos go disastrously wrong. Can the Doctor save the doomed planet in time to save Jo's life?

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mutants
programme.desc: The Marshal is on trial, with the Doctor as chief witness. But Jo and the Doctor's friends are the Marshal's prisoners. Will the Doctor dare to reveal the truth about the Marshal's crimes?

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Warrior
programme.desc: A group of scientists are kidnapped by an alien from the past.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Warrior
programme.desc: The Doctor discovers that the alien is a Sontaran warrior called Linx.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Warrior
programme.desc: Linx is providing advanced weaponry to Irongron and his men.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Warrior
programme.desc: His ship repaired, Linx prepares to take off as the Doctor races to stop history changing.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Planet of the Spiders
programme.desc: (1/6) The Doctor receives a mysterious package from his old companion, Jo Grant.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Planet of the Spiders
programme.desc: (2/6) Lupton, now under the control of a giant spider, steals the blue Metebelis crystal.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Planet of the Spiders
programme.desc: (3/6) Following Lupton, Sarah is accidentally transported to Metebelis 3 where she is captured.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Planet of the Spiders
programme.desc: (4/6) The Doctor is in a coma and Sarah is held prisoner in the spiders' larder.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Planet of the Spiders
programme.desc: (5/6) Sarah makes a bargain with the Spider Queen and returns to Earth with the Doctor.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Planet of the Spiders
programme.desc: (6/6) The Doctor returns to Metebelis 3 where he must face the spider's ruler, the Great One.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mind of Evil
programme.desc: A full scale riot takes place at Stangmoor Prison and Jo is taken hostage.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mind of Evil
programme.desc: The Master plans is to capture a missile and launch it at the World Peace Conference.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mind of Evil
programme.desc: The parasite within the Keller Machine becomes too powerful for the Master to control.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mind of Evil
programme.desc: The Keller Machine is out of control so the Brigadier launches an assault on the prison.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Mind of Evil
programme.desc: The Doctor has no choice but to turn the parasite against the Master.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Colony In Space
programme.desc: (1/6) The TARDIS takes the Doctor and Jo to the future where colonists are menaced by a monster.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Colony In Space
programme.desc: (2/6) The Interplanetary Mining Corporation, led by Captain Dent, arrives on the planet.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Colony In Space
programme.desc: (3/6) When Jo attempts to break into the IMC ship she is captured and held hostage.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Colony In Space
programme.desc: (5/6) The Master forces the Doctor to take him to the underground city of the primitives.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: Colony In Space
programme.desc: (6/6) The Doctor and the Master confront the guardian of the doomsday weapon.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Curse of Peladon
programme.desc: (1/4) The planet Peladon is hoping to join the Galactic Federation.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Curse of Peladon
programme.desc: (2/4) The work of the committee is hampered by sabotage, fear and suspicion.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Curse of Peladon
programme.desc: (3/4) The Doctor is sentenced to a fight to the death.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Curse of Peladon
programme.desc: (4/4) Hepesh is revealed to be behind the attacks.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Monster
programme.desc: Masquerading as research scientist, Professor Thascales, the Master is using a device called TOMTIT to summon an ancient and powerful creature from beyond time.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Monster
programme.desc: The Doctor tracks the Master down to the Newton Institute. There, after a disastrous attempt to summon Kronos, the Master prepares to use TOMTIT once again.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Monster
programme.desc: Krasis, High Priest of Atlantis has been summoned by the Master to help him find the crystal of Kronos. The Master uses TOMTIT to summon threats from the past to attack UNIT.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Monster
programme.desc: As UNIT approaches, the Master leaves for Atlantis in his TARDIS. However, the Doctor is not far behind and in the time vortex, the two Time Lords confront each other.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Monster
programme.desc: Arriving in Atlantis, the Master seduces the beautiful Queen Galleia so that he might possess the crystal of Kronos. But it is protected by a guardian who is half man, half beast.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Time Monster
programme.desc: With the crystal of Kronos in his possession, the Master prepares to release the Chronovore. The Doctor is powerless to stop his nemesis as the end of Atlantis approaches.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Monster of Peladon
programme.desc: (1/6) The Doctor visits the planet Peladon for the first time in fifty years.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Monster of Peladon
programme.desc: (2/6) Chancellor Ortron sentences the Doctor and Sarah to be punished by Aggedor.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Monster of Peladon
programme.desc: (3/6) The Doctor attempts to expose the fraud of Aggedor's ghost.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Monster of Peladon
programme.desc: (4/6) The Ice Warriors take control of Peladon and the Doctor must find a way to stop them.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Monster of Peladon
programme.desc: (5/6) Commander Azaxyr and his Ice Warriors are revealed as traitors, in league with Galaxy 5.

programme.title: Classic Doctor Who: The Monster of Peladon
programme.desc: (6/6) The Doctor and the miners fight to reclaim Peladon from the Ice Warriors.

programme.title: Doctor Who: Death to the Daleks
programme.desc: The TARDIS suffers a power drain and is forced to land on the planet Exxilon.

programme.title: Doctor Who: Death to the Daleks
programme.desc: Dalek weapons are useless due to the power drain so they make a truce with the Doctor.

programme.title: Doctor Who: Death to the Daleks
programme.desc: The Daleks force the Exillons into slave labor to mine the life saving Parrinium.

programme.title: Doctor Who: Death to the Daleks
programme.desc: The Daleks prepare to launch a deadly plague missile that will kill everyone on Exillon.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Sea Devils
programme.desc: The Doctor and Jo visit the Master who is held prisoner on an island

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Sea Devils
programme.desc: The Doctor is eager to make peace between the Sea Devils and the humans.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Sea Devils
programme.desc: Jo attempts to rescue the Doctor who is being held prisoner by the Master and Trenchard.

programme.title: Doctor Who: The Sea Devils
programme.desc: The Doctor attempts to persuade Captain Hart of the danger that the Master represents.
